definitions.definition: A musical instrument of the brass family, generally tuned to the key of B-flat; by extension, any type of lip-vibrated aerophone, most often valveless and not chromatic.
definitions.example: The royal herald sounded a trumpet to announce their arrival.

definitions.definition: Someone who plays the trumpet; a trumpeter.
definitions.example: The trumpets were assigned to stand at the rear of the orchestra pit.

definitions.definition: The cry of an elephant, or any similar loud cry.
definitions.example: The large bull gave a basso trumpet as he charged the hunters.

definitions.definition: One who praises, or propagates praise, or is the instrument of propagating it.
A funnel, or short flaring pipe, used as a guide or conductor, as for yarn in a knitting machine.
A kind of traffic interchange involving at least one loop ramp connecting traffic either entering or leaving the terminating expressway with the far lanes of the continuous highway.
A powerful reed stop in organs, having a trumpet-like sound.

definitions.example: The music trumpeted from the speakers, hurting my ears.
Cedric made a living trumpeting for the change of passersby in the subway.

definitions.definition: Of an elephant, to make its cry.
definitions.example: The circus trainer cracked the whip, signaling the elephant to trumpet.

definitions.definition: To give a loud cry like that of an elephant.
To proclaim loudly; to promote enthusiastically
definitions.example: Andy trumpeted Jane's secret across the school, much to her embarrassment.
